job_purpose: Drive impactful people insights with advanced analytics in a collaborative, high-impact environment.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Design and develop predictive models and algorithms using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques for people-related insights.
Conduct exploratory data analysis, hypothesis testing, and feature engineering across diverse Human Resources datasets.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines from source systems to model deployment.
Translate analytical outcomes into actionable insights and communicate findings through engaging visualizations and reports.
Share knowledge and support capability uplift by mentoring, documentation, and training on analytics tools and techniques.
required_qualifications: Tertiary qualifications in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Strong coding skills in Python, R, and/or SQL.
Proven experience in delivering end-to-end data science projects, preferably involving workforce or behavioral data.
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning methods, and algorithm implementation.
Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
company_details: Our client is seeking a talented and inquisitive Data Scientist to join their People Data & Insights team. This role offers a unique opportunity to operate at the intersection of statistics, technology, and human behavior.
